intro: Paronychia striata, commonly known as the striped groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh conditions.
